com.larphoid.lanudpcomm

Interface ClientInviteHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LanUDPComm

    public interface ClientInviteHandler
    © 2013 Larphoid Apps.
    Since:
    05-09-2013
    Author:
    Larphoid Apps

    This interface is used to report client requests, such as invites, back to your application.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onClientAccepted(java.lang.String[] data, int offset, java.net.DatagramPacket pack)
      Called at the inviting client side, when the target has accepted an invite, to signal the start of the connection.
      java.lang.String[] onInviteAccept()
      Called when this client accepts an invite request, providing a way to send application specific data along with the accept response.
      void onStartConnection(java.lang.String[] data, int offset, java.net.DatagramPacket pack)
      Called at the target side, when the target has accepted an invite, to signal the start of the connection.

    • Method Detail

      • onInviteAccept

        java.lang.String[] onInviteAccept()
        Called when this client accepts an invite request, providing a way to send application specific data along with the accept response.
        Returns:
        An array of Strings as data to send along with the invite response back to the inviting client. May be null if not needed.

      • onStartConnection

        void onStartConnection(java.lang.String[] data,
                     int offset,
                     java.net.DatagramPacket pack)
        Called at the target side, when the target has accepted an invite, to signal the start of the connection.
        If LanUDPComm.needAliveConnection is false, this will always get called without the target having to accept, so that the application can keep track of client status.
        Parameters:
        data - The String array with your application specific data that was specified in onInviteAccept().
        offset - The offset into the Sting array where your application specific data starts.
        pack - This is supplied for convenience reasons. It allows the application to access additional information stored in the DatagramPacket about a connection, such as DatagramPacket.getAddress().

      • onClientAccepted

        void onClientAccepted(java.lang.String[] data,
                    int offset,
                    java.net.DatagramPacket pack)
        Called at the inviting client side, when the target has accepted an invite, to signal the start of the connection.
        If LanUDPComm.needAliveConnection is false, this will always get called if the target's last LanUDPComm.inviteClientForConnection(int, String, String[]) ip equals the inviting client's ip, so that the application can keep track of client status.
        Parameters:
        data - The String array with your application specific data that was specified in onInviteAccept().
        offset - The offset into the Sting array where your application specific data starts.
        pack - This is supplied for convenience reasons. It allows the application to access additional information stored in the DatagramPacket about a connection, such as DatagramPacket.getAddress().
